ing: 1/3 cup rice vinegar, or more to taste
1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil, or to taste
1 tablespoon white sugar, or to taste
1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger, or to taste
1 tablespoon minced lemongrass, or to taste
2 teaspoons soy sauce, or to taste
1 jalapeno pepper, thinly sliced, or to taste
1/2 bunch cilantro, coarsely chopped, or to taste
2 sprigs fresh basil, coarsely chopped, or to taste
n: Thai-Inspired Sunomono with Jalapeno, Cilantro, and Basil
des: "This is a pinch of this recipe, where most of the ingredients are to your taste preference. Two jalapenos provided plenty of delicious heat for me. Garnish with chopped nuts, sesame seeds, and sliced red chile peppers. Furikake is also great as a topping!"
ins: Whisk rice vinegar, sesame oil, sugar, ginger, lemongrass, and soy sauce together in a large bowl. Stir in cucumbers, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, and basil.
